Datasets

List of implemented dataset classes, submodule of DatasetManager

The Datasets submodules have to be a subclass of torch.utils.data.Dataset and have to prepare the tokenized dataset to be used in a torch.utils.data.Dataloader

Each submodule defines the batch composition through the method __getitem__

class entity_typing_framework.dataset_classes.datasets_for_dataloader.ET_Dataset(tokenized_dataset)

This classes organizes the tokenized data inside a dataset_tokenizer into tensors in order to be ready to fed a Dataloader

This dataset saves tokenized_sentences in a single tensor, so it is adapt to be used with Bert-based tokenizers/encoders

Parameters:
tokenized_dataset:

an instance of a Dataset Tokenizer

Attributes:
tokenized_sentences:

numpy array of tokenized sentences extracted from tokenized_dataset

attn_masks:

numpy array of attention masks extracted from tokenized_dataset

one_hot_types:

numpy array of one hot encoding of types extracted from tokenized_dataset

__getitem__(idx)

Override of pytorch.utils.Dataset.__getitem__(), returns a batch when called

Parameters:
idx:

integer index of the element to be returned, see the official pytorch Dataset Documentation

Return:
batch:

a tuple composed of the idx-esim element of tokenized_sencence, the idx-esim element of attn_masks, and the idx-esim element of one_hot_types

__len__()

Override of pytorch.utils.Dataset.__len__(), returns the number of elements in each attribute

Return:

the number of elements in each attribute (a single integer)
